snippet: Desperate patients are turning to therapy at unregulated clinics overseas that say they can treat many diseases. But one man experienced tragic consequences.
abstract: Letter published in The New England Journal of Medicine describes cautionary tale of Jim Gass, who underwent stem cell therapy at clinics in Mexico, China and Argentina to recover from stroke; treatment led to tumor made up of foreign cells growing along his spine, paralyzing him; experts point to case as one of dangers of so-called stem cell tourism.
lead_paragraph: Desperate patients are turning to therapy at unregulated clinics overseas that say they can treat many diseases. But one man experienced tragic consequences.

headline.main: A Cautionary Tale of ‘Stem Cell Tourism’
headline.print_headline: A Cautionary Tale of Stem Cell Therapy Abroad
